attributes.comment:
I disagree with the proposal to increase the fees for international adoption while
not increase how long the I-797 or fingerprints are good for.

My question is who are trying to protect and serve? Is it the intention of the
federal government to protect me from a 6 month orphaned child?

I spent many years and alot of money trying to conceive a child, only to have my
dreams end with miscarriage and an increase of insurance. Now, to complete an
adoption, the government is now telling me that they need to raise the fees so
childless couples have to pay more money to our government to protect us from
identify issues of an infant.

Do our representative realize that the majority of international adoptive parents are
not famous, rich actors like Angelina Jolie but middle class working couple that
have medicore health insurance, a home mortgage, and small amount of savings
to fund adoption. To fund my adoption, I completely stripped the equity in my
home, lost money from missed work, and liquidated my husband's IRA. At the
very last minutes, my fingerprints expired (of course the prints expire but not the
approval - this is assinine) At the very end of the long journey to have to pay
more to our government, is so wrong and unfair to these.

How would each and everyone of our representatives feel if they made less than
$70 thousand per year and have to pay more than $35 thousand to adopt a child
international...and then OUR GOVERNMENT wants us to pay MORE or same fee
multiple times while providing the worst customer service in the United States?

If our government was really working for us, it would place petitions of USA citizen
adoptive parents in a special category. Reduced fees or scaled based, extended
how long the approval is valid for and eliminate the fee for finger-prints redo.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Patricia Andrulot
